title: Enable indexing via robots.txt and sitemap.xml and ensure SEO image assets exist

requirements.summary: Add crawler-friendly rules to robots.txt allowing indexing and pointing to /sitemap.xml.
acceptanceCriteria: robots.txt includes at least: `User-agent: *`, an `Allow` directive (or no Disallow that blocks all), and `Sitemap: <origin>/sitemap.xml` (may use relative `/sitemap.xml`).

file_operations.description: Populate robots.txt with permissive crawling rules (e.g., `User-agent: *`, allow indexing) and include a `Sitemap: /sitemap.xml` directive.

requirements.summary: Create a valid XML sitemap listing indexable public URLs (minimum homepage) matching the appâ€™s canonical origin.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /sitemap.xml returns valid XML (not empty) with a `<urlset>` root element.
Sitemap contains at least one `<url>` entry for the homepage.
Sitemap URLs use the same public origin as the canonical URL used by the app (or are provided as relative URLs if supported by the sitemap generator approach used).

file_operations.description: Populate sitemap.xml as a valid XML sitemap with a `<urlset>` root and at least one `<url>` entry for the homepage, using the same public origin as the canonical URL defined in frontend/index.html (or relative URLs if chosen).
Verify the canonical URL is correct for the intended production origin so sitemap URLs can match it; adjust only if currently incorrect.

requirements.summary: Ensure required social/hero SEO images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with exact referenced filenames.
acceptanceCriteria: `/assets/generated/ml-car-prediction.dim_800x400.jpg` exists in frontend/public/assets/generated and loads in the browser.
`/assets/generated/car-showroom-hero.dim_1200x600.jpg` exists in frontend/public/assets/generated and loads in the browser.
The homepage Hero image renders without broken-image placeholders.

file_operations.description: Add the static SEO/social preview image asset at this exact path/filename so it matches references in frontend/index.html.
Add the static homepage hero image asset at this exact path/filename so it matches references in frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx.
